title: Pmalek
author: Pmalek
content: I am just looking for information at this stage. I should be getting some money either via Wise or Skrill in the near future for some work I did and still do for a client. Since I normally don't work with these e-wallet services, I am not going to withdraw the funds to my bank account/debit card. These are personal and verified accounts btw.I am planning to use the money to buy BTC and USDT for it. Are there trusted members here who accept Wise and Skrill and who would be interested in 1:1 long-term deals perhaps? Escrow can, of course, be part of the deal, we just need to agree on the terms.Post below please or send me a PM.

comments.author: AHOYBRAUSE
comments.body: Quote from: Pmalek on January 28, 2023, 08:06:01 AMI am just looking for information at this stage. I should be getting some money either via Wise or Skrill in the near future for some work I did and still do for a client. Since I normally don't work with these e-wallet services, I am not going to withdraw the funds to my bank account/debit card. These are personal and verified accounts btw.I am planning to use the money to buy BTC and USDT for it. Are there trusted members here who accept Wise and Skrill and who would be interested in 1:1 long-term deals perhaps? Escrow can, of course, be part of the deal, we just need to agree on the terms.Post below please or send me a PM.Actually WISE is not an e-wallet but just another bank account company. You should be able to use it at every exchange that accepts bank wire transfer for deposits without any problem normally. I use WISE myself to send funds to my exchange and buy crypto.

comments.author: alterra57
comments.body: Quote from: AHOYBRAUSE on January 28, 2023, 11:44:51 AMQuote from: Pmalek on January 28, 2023, 08:06:01 AMI am just looking for information at this stage. Escrow can, of course, be part of the deal, we just need to agree on the terms.Post below please or send me a PM.Actually WISE is not an e-wallet but just another bank account company. You should be able to use it at every exchange that accepts bank wire transfer for deposits without any problem normally. I use WISE myself to send funds to my exchange and buy crypto.Which exchange? Wise will block your account if they find out and then they will take 2 months to figure out what's wrong with it.@OP, I accept Wise, I also have a 5 star rating at localcoinswap.com. Hit me up with your Telegram or we can talk through the forum.

comments.author: Pmalek
comments.body: Quote from: alterra57 on January 28, 2023, 12:55:13 PM@OP, I accept Wise, I also have a 5 star rating at localcoinswap.com. Hit me up with your Telegram or we can talk through the forum. All right, good to know. I will keep you in mind when the time comes. Do you have any limits or anything else I should know about?We can talk over the forum's PM system if you don't mind. I am not a big fan of Telegram.

comments.author: Betfair23
comments.body: Quote from: Pmalek on February 01, 2023, 06:57:35 PMBump, still looking.why you dont try p2p in bianance they sell crypto at almost 1.1 for Skrill and wise check it please

comments.author: Pmalek
comments.body: Quote from: Betfair23 on February 02, 2023, 06:54:59 AMwhy you dont try p2p in bianance they sell crypto at almost 1.1 for Skrill and wise check it please Binance is not a decentralized P2P exchange no matter what they say. It's a centralized exchange where you need to undergo identity verification and deposit whatever coins you have into addresses they control. I haven't checked how they handle Wise or Skrill, but I would rather deal with members hear directly.

comments.author: SATWAT
comments.body: Quote from: Pmalek on February 02, 2023, 06:46:19 PMQuote from: Betfair23 on February 02, 2023, 06:54:59 AMwhy you dont try p2p in bianance they sell crypto at almost 1.1 for Skrill and wise check it please Binance is not a decentralized P2P exchange no matter what they say. It's a centralized exchange where you need to undergo identity verification and deposit whatever coins you have into addresses they control. I haven't checked how they handle Wise or Skrill, but I would rather deal with members hear directly. I am mostly needed skrill if you have then I can help you here, and I don't need escrow for this as well just when you have skrill in your account please send me PM here or post here I will be ready for this exchange but keep one thing in mind I only need skrill and my requirement is mostly around $300 monthly not more than this amount.

comments.author: Pmalek
comments.body: Quote from: SATWAT on February 04, 2023, 01:32:34 AMI am mostly needed skrill if you have then I can help you here, and I don't need escrow for this as well just when you have skrill in your account please send me PM here or post here I will be ready for this exchange but keep one thing in mind I only need skrill and my requirement is mostly around $300 monthly not more than this amount. Thanks for getting in touch. I will keep that in mind. However, I haven't had the best of experience with Skrill in the past. Back when it was called Moneybookers, I remember that they were very nosy and showed a tendency towards locking accounts and asking questions who the people you send money to are, where the money comes from, what you use their services for? Despite the account being verified, they still freeze it and investigate for a week or two until they finally reinstate everything back to the way it was.Because of that, my current preference is Wise. Is there something about Wise that you don't like and that's why you don't want it?

comments.author: CryptoRollaOTC
comments.body: Just try bisq.network if you insist on privacy. Hodlhodl is also a good option for you. The other way is to find P2P traders in your city/area who exchange their trading profits, BTC/USDT for cash - the second way carries some risks, be careful who you meet and where you meet. I recommend that you always make small exchanges to minimize the risk of being ripped off or scammed.

comments.author: Pmalek
comments.body: Quote from: CryptoRollaOTC on February 04, 2023, 09:03:03 AMJust try bisq.network if you insist on privacy. Hodlhodl is also a good option for you. I have checked both before creating this thread. Wise is not a very popular payment method on Bisq. Last time I checked there were only 2 orders for Wise in EUR and not a single one for USD. Skrill, on the other hand, is not supported at all. The Hodlhodl margins are just ridiculous and not worth it for anyone. Quote from: CryptoRollaOTC on February 04, 2023, 09:03:03 AMThe other way is to find P2P traders in your city/area who exchange their trading profits, BTC/USDT for cash. Wise and Skrill are not cash on hand. When I have cash on hand, I know where to go with it, same way I know what to do with the crypto.

Despite the account being verified, they still freeze it and investigate for a week or two until they finally reinstate everything back to the way it was.Because of that, my current preference is Wise. Is there something about Wise that you don't like and that's why you don't want it?I check the list and Wise is not allowed in my country, so I can't give any update or information about this right now, but I agreed your all review about Skrill because in past I also face many issues with this service but still this is best for me because at least working in my country and I can withdraw my all funds from here into my bank account.
